itemDescription: British theatre, opera, and television designer

wikipedia_page.main: Michael Yates (20 July 1919 – 28 November 2001) was a British theatre, opera, and television designer.

link_mentions.page: David Geffen School of Drama at Yale University

response: Among the poems that Auden wrote at the Downs were Hearing of harvests; his evocation of his Vision of Agape in June 1933, Out on the lawn I lie in bed (later dedicated to Geoffrey Hoyland); Our hunting fathers; Look, stranger; and, during his return in 1937, the despairing Schoolchildren. He was particularly taken with one of his pupils, Michael Yates, with whom he fell in love for some years and later maintained a lifelong friendship. Auden's time at The Downs was one of the happiest periods in his life.Tony Sharpe; W.H. Auden, Routledge, 2007.
* Michael Yates (1919–2001), stage and television designer and executive
